brief_text:
Geopolitics & Diplomacy
• Japan’s ruling Liberal Democratic Party under Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi is on course for a landslide snap-election win, securing a reported supermajority in the lower house.
• Thailand’s conservatives claim victory, with Prime Minister Anutin’s Bhumjaithai Party holding a commanding lead as vote counting nears completion.
• Iran says it is ready for nuclear-focused talks with the U.S., while rejecting a perceived U.S. military build-up and blaming foreign actors for recent unrest.
• Ethiopia demands Eritrean troops “immediately withdraw” from its territory amid allegations Asmara supports rebel fighters inside Ethiopia.
• Ukraine’s President Zelenskyy says the U.S. proposed a June deadline for Russia and Ukraine to reach a peace agreement.
Why it matters: Major electoral outcomes in Asia, evolving nuclear diplomacy, tensions in the Horn of Africa, and a proposed Ukraine peace timeline could reshape regional alignments and global security calculations.
https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2026/2/8/pm-sanae-takaichis-party-set-for-majority-in-japan-parliamentary-elections
https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cx2jn4z4eq0o?at_medium=RSS&at_campaign=rss
https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2026/2/8/iran-ready-for-nuclear-focused-talks-rejects-us-military-build-up?traffic_source=rss
https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2026/2/8/ethiopia-demands-eritrea-immediately-withdraw-troops-from-its-territory?traffic_source=rss
https://www.npr.org/2026/02/08/nx-s1-5705967/u-s-gave-ukraine-and-russia-june-deadline-to-reach-peace-agreement-zelenskyy-says

Armed Conflict & Security
• Russia names three suspects in the shooting of a general and says alleged gunman Lyubomir Korba was arrested and extradited from Dubai.
• A figure linked to South Africa’s police corruption probe, Wiandre Pretorius, was found dead days after reporting he survived an assassination attempt.
• A suicide bombing at an Islamabad mosque killed 31, underscoring persistent extremist threats in Pakistan’s capital.
Why it matters: Cross-border arrests, corruption-linked violence, and mass-casualty attacks highlight the breadth of security challenges confronting governments and law enforcement.
https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2026/2/8/russia-says-second-suspect-in-generals-shooting-arrested-in-dubai?traffic_source=rss
https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c0j5pg0597po?at_medium=RSS&at_campaign=rss
https://www.npr.org/2026/02/07/nx-s1-5704332/suicide-bombing-at-islamabad-mosque-kills-31-people

Society & Human Rights
• UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s chief of staff resigned amid uproar over appointing Peter Mandelson—linked to Jeffrey Epstein—as U.S. ambassador.
• Iranian Nobel laureate Narges Mohammadi received an additional prison sentence after a December arrest and alleged beating at a memorial.
• Protests against the Winter Olympics in Milan led to arrests and condemnation from Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni, after earlier clashes in Turin.
• In the U.S., civil-rights tensions flared as the White House faced criticism for sharing an edited arrest image of an ICE protester and Trump refused to apologize for a racist video.
• Palestinian student activist Leqaa Kordia, detained by ICE for nearly a year, was hospitalized after a seizure, raising concerns about conditions in detention.
Why it matters: Accountability in democratic institutions, human-rights crackdowns, protest policing, and immigration enforcement are testing public trust and civil liberties across multiple countries.
https://www.npr.org/2026/02/08/nx-s1-5705924/uk-prime-minister-chief-of-staff-quits-epstein-friend-us-ambassador
https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2026/2/8/uk-pms-top-aide-quits-over-mandelsons-links-to-epstein?traffic_source=rss
https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/clygw161wzvo?at_medium=RSS&at_campaign=rss
https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2026/2/8/italys-meloni-condemns-anti-olympics-protesters-in-milan?traffic_source=rss
https://www.bbc.com/news/videos/c86v6p1djvqo?at_medium=RSS&at_campaign=rss
https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2026/2/8/who-is-leqaa-kordia-the-columbia-protester-still-in-ice-detention?traffic_source=rss

Sports
• Manchester City beat Liverpool 2-1 with a stoppage-time Haaland penalty, trimming Arsenal’s lead and prompting debate over a chaotic VAR-reviewed finale.
• Lindsey Vonn crashed out of the Winter Olympics downhill after an ACL rupture; Breezy Johnson took gold in Cortina.
• England edged Nepal by four runs in a final-ball T20 World Cup thriller, avoiding an upset in their opener.
• New Zealand completed their highest T20 World Cup chase to defeat Afghanistan.
• England thrashed Wales to open the Six Nations, though an injury threatens to sideline Immanuel Feyi-Waboso for the tournament.
Why it matters: High-stakes results across football, cricket and winter sports are reshaping title races, national team momentum, and athlete legacies during a packed sports calendar.
https://www.aljazeera.com/sports/2026/2/8/man-city-come-back-to-win-2-1-at-liverpool-and-keep-title-hopes-alive?traffic_source=rss
https://www.aljazeera.com/sports/2026/2/8/lindsey-vonn-%e2%81%a0crashes-out-breezy-johnson-wins-downhill-at-winter-olympics?traffic_source=rss
https://www.bbc.com/sport/cricket/articles/cy4wlvv0kg7o?at_medium=RSS&at_campaign=rss
https://www.bbc.com/sport/cricket/articles/cg4gy559x0vo?at_medium=RSS&at_campaign=rss
https://www.bbc.com/sport/rugby-union/articles/c14mzge4pjjo?at_medium=RSS&at_campaign=rss

Art & Culture
• Ghanaian highlife pioneer Ebo Taylor has died at 90, leaving a widely sampled legacy blending traditional sounds with funk.
• Brad Arnold, lead singer of 3 Doors Down, died at 47 after battling stage 4 cancer.
• The low-budget Canadian series “Heated Rivalry” has become a global hit despite a lack of big-name talent or funding.
• A 70-year-old indigenous teacher, Biana Watre Momin, became a sensation in Indian cinema following a breakout film role.
• Super Bowl LX advertising is expected to be saturated with AI themes, reflecting tech’s deepening influence on marketing.
Why it matters: Cultural losses, unexpected breakout successes, and technology’s imprint on entertainment illustrate how creativity, representation, and innovation are reshaping global audiences.
https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c1e9p04n8y9o?at_medium=RSS&at_campaign=rss
https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cre2egrg5q1o?at_medium=RSS&at_campaign=rss
https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c3edk87vqljo?at_medium=RSS&at_campaign=rss
https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c20zzn77w82o?at_medium=RSS&at_campaign=rss
https://www.theverge.com/entertainment/874504/super-bowl-lx-ads-big-game

Economy & Markets
• Washington Post CEO Will Lewis stepped down after mass layoffs, saying hard choices were needed to ensure the paper’s future.
• Gold’s price surge over the past decade underscores its role as a safe-haven asset amid geopolitical and economic uncertainty.
• Cuba’s fuel crisis and U.S. pressure are driving blackouts and food shortages, prompting emergency measures that strain daily life.
• Sussex cricket’s chairman resigned over financial difficulties triggering points deductions next season.
Why it matters: Media restructuring, safe-haven investing, sanction-induced economic strain, and governance challenges in sport reflect the tight link between finance, policy and livelihoods.
https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c8e5ee39j47o?at_medium=RSS&at_campaign=rss
https://www.aljazeera.com/economy/2026/2/8/understanding-the-value-of-gold-prices-global-reserves-and-market-trends?traffic_source=rss
https://www.aljazeera.com/economy/2026/2/8/from-blackouts-to-food-shortages-how-us-blockade-is-crippling-life-in-cuba?traffic_source=rss
https://www.bbc.com/sport/cricket/articles/cd6zyg3qnjwo?at_medium=RSS&at_campaign=rss

Health & Pandemic
• Nigeria’s snakebite crisis is worsening due to shortages and storage issues for antivenom, exposing gaps in rural health systems.
• A building collapse in northern Lebanon killed at least six and injured seven, with searches ongoing for people trapped under rubble.
Why it matters: Public health capacity and emergency response are critical to reducing preventable deaths and building resilience against everyday and mass-casualty hazards.
https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cdjn1zwm0g7o?at_medium=RSS&at_campaign=rss
https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2026/2/8/building-collapse-in-northern-lebanon-kills-at-least-six?traffic_source=rss

Science & Technology
• Apple is reportedly preparing to launch the iPhone 17e with an A19 chip, MagSafe charging, and in-house cellular components while maintaining price discipline.
• Home automation enthusiasts are building sophisticated custom control panels with Home Assistant, enhancing accessibility and personalization.
• GuliKit’s compact USB adapter enables PS5 DualSense controllers to work wirelessly on Switch 2, broadening cross-platform support.
• Automakers and smartphone firms are advancing digital car key standards at CCC Plugfest to improve security and interoperability.
Why it matters: Consumer tech innovation is accelerating device interoperability, convenience and security across homes, gaming and vehicles.
https://www.theverge.com/tech/875454/iphone-17e-launching-soon-magsafe-a19
https://www.theverge.com/tech/862070/lcars-homes-assistant-star-trek
https://www.theverge.com/tech/874842/gulikit-hyperlink-gen2-usb-adapter-wireless-switch-2-hands-on
https://www.theverge.com/transportation/873197/digital-key-car-ccc-plugfest-rivian

Longevity & Anti-Aging
• Fight Aging! published its weekly newsletter highlighting research and industry developments aimed at controlling aging mechanisms to end age-related disease.
Why it matters: Advances in longevity science could dramatically reduce disease burden, extend healthy lifespans, and reshape healthcare investment.
https://www.fightaging.org/archives/2026/02/fight-aging-newsletter-february-9th-2026/

Geopolitics & Diplomacy.title: Japan's PM Takaichi on course for landslide victory in snap election
Geopolitics & Diplomacy.text: A coalition led by current Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi is expected to clinch a decisive win, an exit poll suggests.

Geopolitics & Diplomacy.title: Thai PM claims election victory with conservatives well ahead of rivals
Geopolitics & Diplomacy.text: The ruling conservatives defied opinion polls predicting a win for the reformist People's Party.

Geopolitics & Diplomacy.title: Ethiopia demands Eritrea ‘immediately withdraw’ troops from its territory
Geopolitics & Diplomacy.text: In recent months, Addis Ababa has accused Eritrea of supporting rebel fighters on Ethiopian soil.

Geopolitics & Diplomacy.title: Iran FM says Tehran ready for deal with US with peaceful nuclear enrichment
Geopolitics & Diplomacy.text: Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi says Tehran is ready to reach a deal with the US.

Geopolitics & Diplomacy.title: Thai PM Anutin’s party on course for victory in general election
Geopolitics & Diplomacy.text: With 90 percent of polling stations reporting results, Anutin's Bhumjaithai Party has a commanding lead.

Geopolitics & Diplomacy.title: Iran ready for nuclear-focused talks, rejects US military build-up
Geopolitics & Diplomacy.text: One month after thousands of protesters were killed across Iran, authorities maintain that US and Israel are to blame.

Geopolitics & Diplomacy.title: PM Sanae Takaichi’s party wins supermajority in Japan snap elections
Geopolitics & Diplomacy.text: Takaichi's Liberal Democratic Party (LDP) won 316 of the 465 seats in the powerful lower house, according to NHK.

Geopolitics & Diplomacy.title: Trump hosts Honduras’s new president Asfura at Mar-a-Lago in US
Geopolitics & Diplomacy.text: The US president praises his newly inaugurated 'friend' and hails strong US-Honduras security ties.

Geopolitics & Diplomacy.title: Somalia’s president on Israel, Somaliland and rising regional tension
Geopolitics & Diplomacy.text: Hassan Sheikh Mohamud on Israel’s Somaliland move, US pressure, security fears and Somalia’s political future.

Geopolitics & Diplomacy.title: How reconstruction became Israel’s new weapon of ‘silent transfer’ in Gaza
Geopolitics & Diplomacy.text: Experts warn promise of reconstruction turns right to shelter into political extortion and alleged demographic change.

Geopolitics & Diplomacy.title: India and Malaysia pledge to bolster trade, defence collaborations
Geopolitics & Diplomacy.text: Both countries emphasize comprehensive partnerships spanning semiconductors, defence, healthcare and food security.

Geopolitics & Diplomacy.title: Video: Israel returns unidentified Palestinian bodies to Gaza
Geopolitics & Diplomacy.text: Israel has returned the bodies of dozens of Palestinians to Gaza, without providing any information on who they are.

Geopolitics & Diplomacy.title: U.S. gave Ukraine and Russia June deadline to reach peace agreement, Zelenskyy says
Geopolitics & Diplomacy.text: "The Americans are proposing the parties end the war by the beginning of this summer," Zelenskyy said, speaking to reporters on Friday.

Geopolitics & Diplomacy.title: Thailand counts votes in early election with 3 main parties vying for power
Geopolitics & Diplomacy.text: Vote counting was underway in Thailand's early general election on Sunday, seen as a three-way race among competing visions of progressive, populist and old-fashioned patronage politics.

Geopolitics & Diplomacy.title: Among U.S.-Iran tensions, concern for an Iranian-American in Evin prison
Geopolitics & Diplomacy.text: As indirect talks begin between the U.S. and Iran over that country's nuclear program, Ryan Fayhee, lawyer for journalist Abdolreza Valizadeh, talks about his concern for his client, who is being held in Evin prison in Tehran.

Geopolitics & Diplomacy.title: Danish vets want an apology from President Trump
Geopolitics & Diplomacy.text: Danish veterans of the war in Iraq want an apology from Trump over Greenland stance.

Armed Conflict & Security.title: Russia names three suspects in shooting of general
Armed Conflict & Security.text: The suspects include the alleged gunman, Lyubomir Korba, whom Russia says fled to the UAE after the attack.

Armed Conflict & Security.title: Man named in South Africa's police corruption probe found dead
Armed Conflict & Security.text: Reports say Wiandre Pretorius, who last week said he survived an assassination attempt, shot himself.

Armed Conflict & Security.title: Russia says second suspect in general’s shooting arrested in Dubai
Armed Conflict & Security.text: Lyubomir Korba is extradited from the UAE, where he fled hours after Friday's attack, Russia's FSB says.

Armed Conflict & Security.title: Suicide bombing at Islamabad mosque kills 31 people
Armed Conflict & Security.text: An update on the suicide bombing in Pakistan's capital that killed 31 people.

Society & Human Rights.title: France murder trial complicated by twin brothers with same DNA
Society & Human Rights.text: Police have recovered DNA from a weapon but cannot determine which of the brothers used it.

Society & Human Rights.title: Iranian Nobel laureate handed further prison sentence, lawyer says
Society & Human Rights.text: Narges Mohammadi was arrested in December for making "provocative remarks" at a memorial, where she was also reportedly beaten.

Society & Human Rights.title: US news anchor Savannah Guthrie says 'we will pay' in plea for mother's return
Society & Human Rights.text: Nancy Guthrie, 84, disappeared in the middle of night from her home in Tucson, Arizona, last weekend.

Society & Human Rights.title: Christchurch shooter seeks to overturn guilty plea
Society & Human Rights.text: Brenton Tarrant is serving a life sentence after murdering 51 people in the March 2019 attack on two mosques in New Zealand.

Society & Human Rights.title: Italian police arrest protesters after clash in Olympic host city Milan
Society & Human Rights.text: At least six people have been detained a week after a different demonstration in Turin turned violent.

Society & Human Rights.title: Australia's opposition coalition reunites after row over hate-speech laws
Society & Human Rights.text: The Nationals had split from the Liberals citing free speech concerns over laws brought in after the Bondi Beach attack.

Society & Human Rights.title: Pakistan's famous kite festival cautiously returns after 19-year ban
Society & Human Rights.text: The event, which dates back centuries, was banned after injuries and fatalities caused by sharp strings and celebratory gunfire.

Society & Human Rights.title: 'I don't want to imagine what happened' - Shock and disbelief in area Nancy Guthrie went missing
Society & Human Rights.text: The disappearance of the 84-year-old mother of news anchor Savannah Guthrie has left a community searching for clues and hoping for her safe return.

Society & Human Rights.title: ICE protester says she was 'disgusted' after fake arrest image shared by White House
Society & Human Rights.text: The White House posted an edited image of Nekima Levy Armstrong after she was arrested for organising a protest in a church.

Society & Human Rights.title: Italy’s Meloni condemns anti-Olympics protesters in Milan
Society & Human Rights.text: Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni slams anti-Olympics protesters as 'enemies of Italy and Italians'.

Society & Human Rights.text: New evidence about Peter Mandelson's relationship with Jeffrey Epstein has recently come to light.

Society & Human Rights.text: Palestinian woman in custody for nearly a year is hospitalised in the US after a seizure at detention facility.

Society & Human Rights.title: US federal agent breaks pet dog’s rib in Tennessee
Society & Human Rights.text: A Tennessee woman says her dog suffered a broken rib after being kicked by a federal officer.

Society & Human Rights.title: Trump won’t apologise despite backlash over video depicting Obamas as apes
Society & Human Rights.text: Trump has refused to apologise for a now-deleted video that depicted Michelle and Barack Obama as apes.

Society & Human Rights.title: Protests against ICE and Israel at Winter Olympics in Milan
Society & Human Rights.text: Protests erupted in Italy against the Winter Olympics to condemn Israel’s participation and the presence of ICE agents.

Society & Human Rights.title: U.K. leader's chief of staff quits over hiring of Epstein friend as U.S. ambassador
Society & Human Rights.text: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer's chief of staff resigned Sunday over the furor surrounding the appointment of Peter Mandelson as U.K. ambassador to the U.S. despite his ties to Jeffrey Epstein.

Society & Human Rights.title: Former Tumblr head Jeff D’Onofrio steps in as acting CEO at the Washington Post
Society & Human Rights.text: After what can generously be called a contentious tenure as the CEO of The Washington Post, Will Lewis is stepping down following mass layoffs this week. Jeff D'Onofrio, former CEO of Tumblr from 2017 to 2022, will step in as acting CEO and publisher. D'Onofrio has been CFO at the Post since June of last […]

Society & Human Rights.title: Slot bemoans luck with referees in loss to Man City
Society & Human Rights.text: Liverpool manager Arne Slot says the club have had poor luck with referees this season, believing that Marc Guehi should have been sent off for a challenge on Mohamed Salah in their loss to Manchester City.

Society & Human Rights.title: Rockets' Sengun sorry for sexist remark at official
Society & Human Rights.text: Houston Rockets centre Alperen Sengun says he has apologised to the female official he aimed a sexist remark at during a defeat by the Boston Celtics.

Sports.title: US skier Vonn crashes in downhill run while competing with torn ACL
Sports.text: American superstar skier Lindsey Vonn "deserved a better ending" after suffering heartbreak in what could be her final Olympic event as she crashes in the women's downhill competition in Cortina.

Sports.text: ‌Stoppage-time penalty from Erling Haaland gives City ‍dramatic win and narrows gap to ⁠leaders Arsenal to six points.

Sports.text: Lokesh Bam's late heroics with bat are not enough as Nepal are beaten by two-time champions in Group C match in Mumbai.

Sports.title: Liverpool 1-2 Manchester City: Premier League – as it happened
Sports.text: All the updates as City mount late comeback to reduce Arsenal's lead at the top of Premier League back to six points.

Sports.title: Lindsey Vonn ⁠crashes out; Breezy Johnson wins downhill at Winter Olympics
Sports.text: Skiing icon Lindsey Vonn fell seconds into her run of the women's downhill just days after sustaining an ACL injury.

Sports.title: Afghanistan lose to New Zealand in T20 World Cup opener
Sports.text: Tim Seifert and Glenn ‍Phillips rally in the middle order to help New Zealand overcome Afghanistan in Chennai, India.

Sports.title: 'Killjoy' - did VAR get late drama in Liverpool v Man City right?
Sports.text: Manchester City's win at Liverpool ended in complete chaos - but did the referee and the VAR get Dominik Szoboszlai's red card right?

Sports.title: An almighty scare - but are England learning?
Sports.text: Why some subtle signs suggest, despite their scare against Nepal in the T20 World Cup, England might be learning under Harry Brook and Brendon McCullum.

Sports.title: Man City produce late comeback to beat Liverpool in chaotic finale
Sports.text: Erling Haaland's 93rd-minute penalty gives Manchester City a crucial comeback win over Liverpool, who end the game with 10 men as Dominik Szoboszlai is sent off in stoppage time at Anfield.

Sports.title: 'The shirt used to weigh heavy - now England players double in size in it'
Sports.text: World Cup winner Matt Dawson discusses England's seven-try thrashing of Wales and the lessons coach Steve Borthwick can learn from France.

Sports.title: 'Experience told' in World Cup defeat - Stirling
Sports.text: Ireland captain Paul Stirling says his side lacked a cutting edge in vital periods of the game as they lost by 20 runs to co-hosts Sri Lanka in the T20 World Cup Group B opener.

Sports.title: Smith's versatility and 'contagious' positivity driving Arsenal
Sports.text: Olivia Smith's talent and versatility is helping to kick-start a drifting Arsenal side back into life as they chase silverware on three fronts.

Sports.title: Crystal Palace end winless run with victory over rivals Brighton
Sports.text: Ismaila Sarr scores the only goal of the game as Crystal Palace end a run of nine Premier League games without a win, by beating rivals Brighton 1-0 at the AMEX Stadium.

Sports.title: GB's curlers beat hosts Italy to top standings
Sports.text: Bruce Mouat and Jen Dodds bounce back from their first defeat in the mixed doubles curling to record an eighth win that confirms they will finish top of the standings going into the semi-finals.

Sports.title: GB's medal hope Brookes starts campaign - Sunday's Winter Olympics guide
Sports.text: What's happening and who to look out for at the 2026 Winter Olympics in Milan-Cortina.

Sports.title: Super Bowl countdown almost over as Patriots to face Seahawks
Sports.text: After a week of frenzied build-up in the San Francisco Bay Area, Super Bowl 60 - America's biggest game - takes place on Sunday night.

Sports.title: Vonn crashes out of Winter Olympics downhill
Sports.text: American skier Lindsey Vonn crashes in the women's downhill competition at the Winter Olympics, nine days after rupturing her left anterior cruciate ligament.

Sports.title: England survive scare to beat Nepal in World Cup thriller
Sports.text: Will Jacks' late flurry of 39 runs off 18 balls proved to be key as England narrowly avoid a shocking upset against minnows Nepal, winning by four runs in their opening game of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup.

Sports.title: 'Clutch' final jump gives Japan star big air snowboard gold
Sports.text: Watch Japan's Kira Kimura win gold in the men's big air snowboarding final, as his last jump scores highest to beat compatriot Ryoma Kimata.

Sports.title: 'England can't get carried away with big win over Wales'
Sports.text: BBC Sport pundit Chris Ashton believes England have made a "great start" to the Six Nations, but warns they should not look at their 48-7 win over Wales as anything other than "a building block" for the rest of the tournament.

Sports.title: Seifert half-century helps NZ beat Afghanistan
Sports.text: New Zealand pull off their highest run chase in T20 World Cup history as they open their Group D campaign with a five-wicket win over Afghanistan.

Sports.title: England deny Nepal in final-ball World Cup thriller
Sports.text: England fight from the brink to avoid a major shock and beat an inspired Nepal by four runs in their opening match of the T20 World Cup in Mumbai.

Sports.title: Ireland let Sri Lanka off the hook at World Cup
Sports.text: Ireland cannot overcome a host of errors in the field as they fall 20 runs short of co-hosts Sri Lanka in their World Cup opener.

Sports.title: Pakistan officials meet ICC over India boycott
Sports.text: Officials from the ICC and the PCB will meet in Lahore on Sunday for talks over Pakistan's planned boycott of their T20 World Cup match against India.

Sports.title: England's Feyi-Waboso could miss whole Six Nations
Sports.text: England wing Immanuel Feyi-Waboso will miss the Calcutta Cup match against Scotland next weekend and is in danger of missing the entire Six Nations.

Sports.title: Same old story for sorry Wales in Six Nations
Sports.text: Wales' 12th consecutive Six Nations loss in a run dating back to 2023 is more evidence of how far they have fallen.

Sports.title: England's riot club focus on fine-tuning after walloping Wales
Sports.text: Steve Borthwick has the pleasure of nit-picking through fine details after his England side swat aside Wales in their Six Nations opener.

Sports.title: Reed continues fine form with Qatar Masters win
Sports.text: American Patrick Reed continues his fine form on the DP World Tour with victory at the Qatar Masters by two shots over Scotland's Calum Hill.

Sports.title: Wigan, Wakefield and Bradford advance in Challenge Cup
Sports.text: Wigan Warriors and Wakefield Trinity both score more than 80 points as fellow Super League sides Bradford Bulls and Catalan Dragons also reach round four.

Sports.title: Zhao wins all-Chinese World Grand Prix final
Sports.text: Zhao Xintong beats Chinese compatriot Zhang Anda 10-6 to win the World Grand Prix - his first ranking title since being crowned world champion last May.

Sports.title: Frost hat-trick caps resounding Bath success at Sale
Sports.text: Bath hooker Dan Frost scores a hat-trick of tries as the Prem Cup holders demolish Sale 60-19 to boost their hopes of securing a play-off spot.

Sports.title: Saracens thrash Leicester as Quins and Exeter draw
Sports.text: Saracens score 13 tries in an 81-0 thrashing of Leicester Tigers to keep up the pressure on Gloucester-Hartpury at the top of the Premiership Women's table.

Sports.title: Real Madrid step up Rodri interest - Sunday's gossip
Sports.text: Real Madrid are stepping up interest in Manchester City midfielder Rodri, Arsenal are among clubs keen on Leon Goretzka and Manchester United and Newcastle target Michael Kayode, plus more.

Sports.title: 'Catalogue of errors' as Ireland drop several catches against Sri Lanka
Sports.text: Ireland drop multiple catches in a poor fielding display against Sri Lanka in their opening game at the ICC Men's T20 World Cup.

Sports.title: England make flying start with convincing win over poor Wales
Sports.text: Watch highlights as a hat-trick from Henry Arundell helps England dominate a disappointing Wales side in their opening Six Nations match.

Sports.title: Arsenal end Man City's 13-game winning streak
Sports.text: Watch highlights of Arsenal's 1-0 win over Manchester City as Olivia Smith's strike inflicts City's first Women's Super League defeat since the opening day of the season.

Sports.title: Bethell hits quick-fire fifty for England
Sports.text: England's Jacob Bethell scores 55 from 35 balls during their T20 World Cup match against Nepal in Mumbai.

Sports.title: Chelsea see off Tottenham to move third in WSL
Sports.text: Goals from Keira Walsh and Alyssa Thompson ease Chelsea to a 2-0 victory over Tottenham to move the Blues third in the WSL.

Sports.title: The new top-flight Canadian club inspired by Athletic Bilbao
Sports.text: Supra du Quebec kick off their inaugural Canadian Premier League in April and will field only players born or raised in the province.

Sports.title: How Ekitike has already become a Liverpool cult hero
Sports.text: Inside the rise of Hugo Ekitike, adapting to life in England, connecting with Florian Wirtz and why he's already a fan favourite.

Art & Culture.text: The guitarist, composer and band leader fused Ghanaian music and funk to create tracks sampled around the world.

Art & Culture.text: The Mississippi-born frontman of the popular rock band had announced a stage 4 cancer diagnosis in May 2025.

Art & Culture.title: No big names. No big budget. But Heated Rivalry is a big hit
Art & Culture.text: The made-on-a-shoe-string, Canadian-produced series is taking the world by storm.

Art & Culture.title: From classroom to camera: A teacher who has become a sensation in Indian cinema
Art & Culture.text: At 70, indigenous teacher Biana Watre Momin acted in an Indian film that has changed her life.

Art & Culture.title: Super Bowl LX ads: all AI everything
Art & Culture.text: Super Bowl LX is nearly here, with the Seattle Seahawks taking on the New England Patriots. While Bad Bunny will be the star of the halftime show, AI could be the star of the commercial breaks, much like crypto was a few years ago. Last year’s Super Bowl featured a Google Gemini ad that fumbled […]

Economy & Markets.title: Washington Post chief executive steps down after mass lay-offs
Economy & Markets.text: Will Lewis says "difficult decisions" had been made to ensure the newspaper's future.

Economy & Markets.title: Understanding the value of gold: Prices, global reserves, and market trends

Economy & Markets.title: From blackouts to food shortages: How US blockade is crippling life in Cuba

Longevity & Anti-Aging.title: Fight Aging! Newsletter, February 9th 2026
Longevity & Anti-Aging.text: Fight Aging! publishes news and commentary relevant to the goal of ending all age-related disease, to be achieved by bringing the mechanisms of aging under the control of modern medicine. This weekly newsletter is sent to thousands of interested subscribers. To subscribe to the newsletter, please visit: https://www.fightaging.org/newsletter/. To unsubscribe, send email or reply to this email at newsletter@fightaging.org with "unsubscribe" in the subject or body.
